name: The Tides South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3rd time at Tides in South Beach and once again a confirmation. New ownership but same high-quality sevice. Starting from the complimentary sweet breakfast with pastries and coffee (better than two years ago - pastries are amazing), gorgeous rooms (all ocean view), free chairs + umbrella at the beach in front of the hotel and also a beautiful private pool on the hotel 1st floor. Try the "bites-on-the-go" menu pool-side, all dishes are amazing, burger as well! Last but not least, one night I had a problem with my toilette, I called our personal assistan at the reception and in 2 minutes there were 3 people in the room, fixing the problem, cleaning everything and going out respecting our privacy, it was a rare example of efficency and 5 stars service. We absolutely LOVE Tides Hotel and we can't wait to go back again.
reviews.title: a hit once again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very nice stay at the Tides. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are very nicely decorated and very clean. We paid for an ocean view room and it was well worth the extra money. We had an amazing full view of the beach, which was lovely in the morning when the sun streams through the windows. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We never walked past a staff member who didn't say hello, and the staff at the front desk really went out of their way to answer any question or request that we had. While South Beach is full of places to eat, the best meals that we had were actually at the hotel. They have a very nice patio that serves great food. We loved the free beach chairs and umbrellas that the hotel provides at the beach, which is directly across the street from the hotel. We did not spend any time at the pool so can only say that it's very small and situated at the back of the building with no view at all. There were two negatives that prevent me from giving a 5 star review. (1) The strip of Ocean Ave that the hotel is located on is full of VERY loud bars where the workers stand on the street soliciting you to come in so walking to and from the hotel is like running a gauntlet of touts. When the bar next door is hosting its drag queen show, you can't even approach the hotel from that direction as the street gets so full of people. (2) The bathrooms in some of the rooms are separated from the rest of the room by a clear glass wall so when you shower, you are exposed to the rest of the room, which could be uncomfortable for those who don't like to put on a show while washing their private parts. We stayed in the hotel at the beginning and the end of our trip so we had two different rooms - one had this feature and one didn't. One additional note - an 18% gratuity is added automatically to every bill so check your receipts before adding any additional tips. All in all, it was a very nice stay on both occasions. I think we would stay there again if we ever went back.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with Excellent Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is gorgeous. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous - feel more like a condo. The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming...the welcome cocktail is a nice touch. The hotel is right on South Beach...which has gone down in my opinion - too much like a bad rap video (don't flame me either, I'm a hip-hop/rap/screw head). The hotel has complimentary beach chairs and umbrella & towels for its guest across the street on the beach. The hotel is noisy as its right on Ocean Drive...what can you expect though, if you want peace and quiet stay elsewhere...but if you wanted peace and quiet would you really stay on Ocean Drive or come to South Beach?
reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Me & My husband and some of my co-workers from London decided to travel to the famous south beach.On out trip we stayed here at the Tides and it was a most memorable trip. the hotel is beautiful and the rooms are great & very elegant. At check-in we were rushed in and not greeted properly. Almost as if we were not important. but we figured it was the afternoon rush. and maybe they were just tired. We did not know where to go and we received really quick & Horrible suggestions from the guy at the front desk. On the first night not really thinking good thoughts of the hotel staff, we had the opportunity to meet Brent, we explained to him what had happened earlier during the day and he told us not to worry he will be our personal assistant while we were staying at the tides. This is this first time we have ever traveled and someone said that to us. we were very impressed. He booked everything for us. Three great restaurants- The Forge- STK- Blt Steak. The food was excellent. We received free entry to club mansion & club set & line jumpers.we told him next time he has to join us! We took a tour of the everglades.! Brent made our trip perfect. Loved the complementary chairs and towels at the beach. Over all the stay at King & Grove was Excellent we will be back same time next year!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel- Great Staff Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: I'm sitting here right now writing this review. We have been trying to find the best place with the best food.... Welp I'm in love right now. Lol. Please eat here.... We had the breakfast, we plan on coming back for dinner... We dont have a room here so I can't speak on that. But the food is really good
reviews.title: Must. Eat. The. Food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: There are certainly a lot of good things going for The Tides - its right in the centre of Ocean Drive, so perfect if you want to be at the heart of the South Beach action. This of course has its down side, as this end of the beach has become a little downmarket and draws the crowds. I had a room right next door to a very loud bar - which can certainly kick any tranquility out of an evening in your room. However, the room itself was very nice. Spacious and well decorated, with everything you would expect from a quality hotel. The work finish was a little cheap in places - but overall very satisfying. The staff are friendly enough, but you very much have to approach them and the execution of service is a bit shoddy and laid back. There is no management presence and this might be the route of the hotel's problems. The restaurant pushes out some nice cuisine - but nothing earth shattering (they do a lovely Cobb Salad). There is a pool, that is tucked away round the rear of the hotel - so perfect to escape from the crowds. However, no spa (only in-room treatments can be arranged). There is free WiFi - which is always a great positive. For the price, its not a bad option in the area - but there are better choices.
reviews.title: Good - but with some down sides

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Title says it all really... nice hotel and location and some very cool features, but whoever set the prices was massively deluded. Need to do a lot more to make the service excellent relative to price.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but if you're going to charge top dollar i expect more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My visit to the King & Grove was wonderful. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and stylish, amenities great, food at the restaurant delicious, but the best part was the impeccable service. The staff was extremely helpful, accomodating and friendly. They went out of their way to ensure our party was well taken care of. They assisted with our needs both before arrival (dinner reservations) and while on site. I would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Wonderful Service, Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel, with a huge room. The staff were very friendly and accommodating – I was expecting sour staff as expected in many modern hotels, The Tides was the complete opposite. The pool was nice, very clean – although it lacked a bar/snacks. Perhaps they have this during peak travel months though. The beach service is great – not to have to pay $50 for loungers & umbrellas is a great savings, and should be taken into consideration if your pricing out hotels in Miami and think Tides is too expensive. The hotel also has a decent fitness room with cardio, weights, yoga mats, BOSU ball, etc. Its small (500 sq foot?) but perfectly sufficient to get a good workout in. The décor is truly remarkable – both in the rooms & in the foyer/dining room.
reviews.title: Beautifully Decorated Hotel w/ Huge Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only word of warning I have, is that the bathrooms may pose a problem for families. Literally the shower area is see-through glass (not frosted), and the toilet has no separate door, other than a half frosted panel. This may not be the case for all rooms - so perhaps call in advance if you think this might be an issue. I suspect for rooms with 2 beds, they probably have a different set-up.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel with great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The K&GT was great, friendly and helpful staff, and great food. The pool experience is not equal to the rest of the hotel. It is small and faces the alley, not great for pool relaxation with garbage pick-up, employees coming and going to surrounding businesses, etc. Despite the pool being a disappointment, the remainder of the hotel is 4.5, food (mahi tacos were awesome), staff, and location fantastic.
reviews.title: Great hotel, just not a great pool area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: So I stayed at this hotel with my close friend and we had an amazing time I really enjoyed the vibe of the hotel from being greeted at the door to the day of given our farewell before coming home. along with its restaurant the next door hotel was really loud but it did not effect us at all we enjoyed breakfast lunch and dinner at the hotel but unfortunately the servers seem to be not really getting much business which is sad how slow the business was. We had a weekend full of beautiful weather before it got rain but when it did rain we went to the pool which had a beautiful view we had a guy named Bob who waited on us at the pool despite the rain he got soaked but made sure the food was safe from the rain and made sure we were well taken car of which was one that stood out. another situation was the excellent choices of wine we were offered when we lounged out front ps love the 6 dollar mojitos overall the room, service, food, and hotel was the best experience in south beach we ever had
reviews.title: Best Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: three days in this stunning hotel werent enough. the room was spotless & well maintained as was the bar/restaurant & the pool. staff couldnt have been more friendly or helpful. francisco at front of house was a fountain of knowledge about where to eat etc.. We would definately rebook the tides on our next visit & hopefully get to enjoy the experience for a longer stay. well done to all of you @the tides.loved it loved it. lee mccormick glasgow scotland
reviews.title: recent stay at the tides miami

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. When we arrived you where offered the complementary drinks. The room was spacious, modern, a fridge and we even had a walk in closet to store our belongings. Every one was friendly and eager to help us.....they had umbrellas available for us to use when it started raining . The location was a perfect access to the beach quickly or just hanging out for entertainment. My one compliant: at check -in we learned that there was $150.00 per night incident fee. I was pissed, not because of the fee but we were not notified until check-in, even through we called to make a reservation. "I said guess should be notified ahead of time of the 150.00 dollar fee, that's a lot of money. The man at the desk did not care he tried to make us feel bad because we where using a check card instead of Credit Card.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service oriented, discreet and classy. My wife and I couldn't have enjoyed our 3 day stay more. Alain and Nory anticipated our needs and were always one step ahead in meeting them. They were exceptional hosts, and terrific ambassadors for the hotel.
reviews.title: Understated Elegance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: It is really a good hotel right on Ocean Drive. I know some have complained about it being noicy but we didn´t notice any of that. We had a great stay there for four nights. You have access to beach chairs and umbrellas at the beach and a pool with chairs. We used both and they were both very good. We also used the valet parking and it worked perfectly much better then at other hotels I have stayed at in Miami. We also got great tips from the staff about where to go etc. We are very pleased with our stay at the Tides.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel at a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside was there breakfast. The service was bad. We had to ask for everything. I took a full american breakfast. I got the eggs but not the tea and toasts. Had to ask for that. We had also ordered panncakes and they were not cooked. They happily took them back but when the new ones arrived we had to ask for more syrup. First we had wanted to order a sandwich but that was not possible cause it was the lunch meny but then we saw a table that got a sandwish. We just didn´t have breakfast there again and that problem was solved. We did order food by the pool and that worked excellent.
reviews.title: 2nd Stay at the Tides

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Tides from July 12-15 rm 302 returning for our anniversary. Upon checking in we were over charged $1700. The front desk agents Fabiola and Ficky worked hard getting our problem resolved with our bank, my wife was very upset when she woke up Sat. morning and saw the charges still on her account. The Tides fixed our problem and also gave us dinner and half off a nights stay. This is a very nice Hotel I would rate it #1 hotels on Ocean Drive. I would also like to give special thanks to the restaurant manager Mr. Julio Sotelo. My wife and I want to thank you for excellent service you provides to us. Julio takes customer service to the next level, he is THE BEST manager in Miami hand down the best!!! Everytime Iam in South Beach I will be staying only at the Tides.
reviews.title: Definitely NOT #4 hotel of South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: This is the first review I've written but I really feel the need because Trip Advisor is SO off in their ranking. The Tides is by no means a bad hotel. It's fine. But it's deifnitely not #4. We stopped by the W and the Delano amongst others and they are just in a totally other class. The Tides is sort of falling apart already. The furnishings are rusted and it's sad that they just aren't taking care of the place, because it is nicely decorated. The hotel was EMPTY. There were 2 bars and during our whole 5 day trip we didn't see a soul manning either bar. And this includes a Sat night. The restaurant never had a single body in it. The pool is tiny, which is ok but it backs up to the kitchen of the drag show and has cable wires overhead. It's not ideal.
reviews.title: Oasis of Serenity in SoBe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: Then there was our room...First glance, it's really pretty and pretty spacious. But our room didn't have hot water. Like at all. They sent an engineer out and he was like, feels fine to me. We were literally shivering in our shower. Eventually they moved us to another room, 4 hours later, on the same floor. God forbid they give us a higher floor (we were on the 2nd floor where the noise was loud). We were told the hotel was full. Which as mentioned, the hotel was clearly empty. We then ordered something to eat at the pool while we waited. (20 dollar guacamole). And we waited and waited and waited. Nothing was said or done to compensate for our lost time while we waited for permission to get into our new room.
reviews.title: SoBe at its best

description: The Tides South Beach is an iconic hotel located on Ocean Drive, just steps from the crystal water of the Atlantic Ocean  and Miami’s most exciting dining and nightlife locations. Originally built in 1936, the hotel’s architecture is rich with Art Deco influences, creating a nostalgic environment for The Tides’ unique brand of modern luxury. The Tides features forty-four stylish luxury suites all offering expansive ocean views. Spacious hotel accommodations range from Oceanfront Studio Suites of 550 square feet to the 2,600 square foot Tides Suite.
